title: Chris Cairns trial: Ricky Ponting says he was with Brendon McCullum when proposition was made
text:
Video Image Relive Chris Cairns at his best 1:08 Cricket: Relive some of New Zealand batsman Chris Cairns' best innings against Australia
October 14th 2015 6 days ago /video/video.news.com.au/Sport/Cricket/News/ Ricky Pontting has appeared at the Chris Cairns perjury trial via video link from Australia.
FOX SPORTS FORMER Australia captain Ricky Ponting has told the Chris Cairns perjury trial that he was with Brendon McCullum when the Kiwi received a business proposition from Cairns in 2008.
Ponting told the Southwark Crown Court via video link from Australia that he was in the same Indian hotel room as McCullum when he spoke to Cairns on the telephone.
“We were just sitting, sharing a drink, when he received a phone call — his phone rang,” Ponting said. “It was a very brief phone conversation, probably less than five minutes.
“He put the phone down, hung up and said it was Cairnsy and he ‘just made me a business proposition’.
“We stayed together for a short time. I didn’t ask any more questions ... As soon as I heard it was about business, I wasn’t interested any more.”
Chris Cairns arrives at Southwark Crown Court to stand trial for perjury. Source: AP
Ponting and McCullum were at the time playing for the Kolkata Knight Riders in the IPL. The pair were staying in the same hotel on the eve of the inaugural Indian Premier League event.
McCullum gave evidence last week claiming Cairns had told him he was the perfect player to engage in spot-fixing whereas some of his countrymen “wouldn’t have the balls” to do it.
McCullum said Cairns approached him twice about spot-fixing but acknowledged he made a mistake by failing to report the approaches to the ICC’s anti-corruption unit.
Ponting was cross-examined by defence lawyer Orlando Pownall QC on Tuesday and asked whether he considered McCullum knew about match-fixing or needed it explained to him.
“Right now, I would; in 2008, not so much,” Ponting replied, later agreeing to a question that a phone call about a business proposition would’ve been “wholly unremarkable”.
Brendon McCullum says Chris Cairns approached him to engage in spot-fixing. Source: Getty Images
Ponting said he had never talked about the call with McCullum again.
“For a start I wasn’t aware Brendon had gone and spoken to Chris Cairns,” Ponting said. “It was none of my business. Brendon’s private life and business life was none of my business, I wasn’t going to ask him.”
Other former cricketers have given evidence at the trial, including Black Caps Kyle Mills, Shane Bond and Shane Bond.
Cairns was accused of match-fixing in 2010 by then IPL chairman Lalit Modi when he was playing for the Chandigarh Lions in the Indian Cricket League (ICL) two years earlier.
Cairns sued and won damages but is now accused of lying under oath in the libel case when he said he’d “never” cheated at cricket.
The maximum sentence for perjury is seven years in prison.
